text: Robert Coleman Richardson (June 26, 1937 - February 19, 2013) was an American experimental physicist. He was known for his works on sub-millikelvin temperature studies of helium-3. He won the 1996 Nobel Prize in Physics. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2013 deaths Category:American physicists Category:Scientists from Washington, D.C.
title: Robert Coleman Richardson
